document_metadata.title: Incentives & Accountability Hypotheses - Rackspace Technology, Inc.

hypothesis_framework.hypothesis: Incentive misalignment (measuring activity not outcomes) drives execution failure more than capability deficits—individuals acting rationally under incentive structure create aggregate organizational dysfunction
supporting_evidence_sought: Execution failures where capability exists but incentive misdirects effort (sales capacity exists but profitability destroyed, support capacity exists but satisfaction declining)
Activity metrics stable/improving while outcome metrics degrade (SLA met but satisfaction down, bookings maintained but margins down)
Rational individual behavior creating irrational organizational outcomes (sales maximizing bookings destroys business value)
Policy interventions treating symptoms not incentive root cause (sales refresh changes personnel not compensation structure, walk away policy reactive not proactive)
disconfirming_evidence_sought: Execution failures attributed to capability/skill deficits rather than incentive misalignment
Activity and outcome metrics aligned (activity improvement drives outcome improvement)
Evidence of incentive structure aligned with outcomes (compensation tied to delivered results not activities)
Proactive incentive reforms addressing root causes (not reactive policy interventions)

supporting: Sales: Capacity exists (400+ reps) but margins eroding (Private Cloud -13%, Public Cloud -3%)—sales incentive on bookings not profitability
Support: SLA response times met but satisfaction declining (Trustpilot 'consistently worse' 2024)—support incentive on response not resolution
Operations: Incident response capable but incidents recurring—operations incentive on response not prevention
Activity/outcome divergence: SLA met/satisfaction down, bookings maintained/margins down, tickets processed/issues unresolved
Reactive interventions: Sales refresh Q3 2024 (personnel), walk away policy Q4 2024 (CEO enforcement)—symptoms addressed not incentive structure
disconfirming: No evidence of capability deficits as primary driver—sales has reps, support has engineers, operations has incident response
No evidence of activity/outcome alignment—divergence pattern consistent
No evidence of proactive incentive reform—only reactive policy interventions

hypothesis_framework.notes: Multiple execution failure patterns show individuals acting rationally under incentive structure (maximize bookings, meet SLA, respond to incidents) while creating organizational dysfunction (margin erosion, satisfaction decline, incident recurrence). Activity metrics mask outcome degradation until crisis forces recognition. Interventions treat symptoms (personnel changes, reactive policies) not root cause (incentive misalignment). Hypothesis: Realigning incentives to outcomes (delivered profitability, resolution quality, incident prevention) would change behavior more effectively than capability additions or personnel changes.

hypothesis_framework.hypothesis: Accountability voids (responsibility without authority, authority without accountability) create execution drag more than individual performance deficits—structural misalignment not individual failure drives dysfunction
supporting_evidence_sought: Execution failures where accountability exists but authority absent (BU Presidents accountable for P&L without cross-functional authority, support accountable for satisfaction without resolution authority)

Execution failures where authority exists but accountability absent (sales has booking authority without profitability accountability, engineering has deployment authority without stability accountability)
Rational escalation behavior when accountability-authority misaligned (BU Presidents escalate to CEO, support coordinates informally)
Accountability void persistence across personnel changes (three CEOs, sales refresh—void recreates)
disconfirming_evidence_sought: Execution failures attributed to individual performance rather than structural accountability voids
Evidence of accountability-authority alignment (authority matches responsibility)
Evidence of accountability void resolution through structural reform (not personnel changes)
Successful autonomous execution without escalation (indicating authority-accountability alignment)

supporting: BU Presidents accountable for P&L, lack authority over sales/shared services/technology—rational escalation to CEO creates bottleneck
Support accountable for satisfaction, lacks authority to compel cross-functional resolution—rational informal coordination through heroics
Sales has booking authority, lacks profitability accountability—rational volume maximization destroys margins
Engineering has deployment authority, lacks stability accountability—rational feature velocity degrades stability
Accountability voids persist across personnel changes: Three CEOs—bottleneck recreates, sales refresh Q3 2024—margin erosion continues
No successful autonomous execution examples—cross-functional coordination requires CEO intervention or informal heroics
disconfirming: No evidence of individual performance deficit as root cause—personnel changes don't resolve voids
No evidence of accountability-authority alignment—voids persist structurally
No evidence of structural void resolution—only reactive interventions

hypothesis_framework.notes: Multiple accountability voids identified where responsibility and authority misaligned. Individuals acting rationally within structural constraints create organizational drag: BU Presidents escalate (lack authority), support coordinates informally (lacks authority), sales books unprofitably (lacks accountability), engineering ships unstably (lacks accountability). Personnel changes (three CEOs, sales refresh) don't resolve voids—structural issue not individual issue. Hypothesis: Aligning authority with accountability (or removing accountability without authority) would reduce drag more effectively than personnel optimization.

hypothesis_framework.hypothesis: Local optimization under misaligned incentives creates global dysfunction—individuals maximizing measured local performance destroy unmeasured enterprise value
supporting_evidence_sought: Functions optimizing local metrics at enterprise expense (sales maximizes bookings destroys margins, support maximizes SLA response destroys resolution, operations maximizes incident response defers prevention)
Measured metrics improving while enterprise performance deteriorating (activity metrics stable, financial results declining)
Rational myopic behavior—optimize current measured performance even if creates future unmeasured cost
Enterprise outcome degradation forcing reactive intervention (CEO walk away policy, sales refresh) after local optimization accumulates
disconfirming_evidence_sought: Evidence of enterprise optimization incentives (functions measured on enterprise outcomes not local activities)
Local and enterprise metrics aligned (local optimization drives enterprise value)
Proactive enterprise optimization behavior without CEO intervention
Cross-functional coordination optimizing enterprise value over local metrics

supporting: Sales local optimization (bookings maximization) destroys enterprise value (margin erosion Private Cloud -13%, Public Cloud -3%)
Support local optimization (SLA response) destroys enterprise value (customer satisfaction declining, churn risk)
Operations local optimization (incident response) destroys enterprise value (incident recurrence, reactive spending exceeds prevention cost)
Finance local optimization (budget variance control) destroys enterprise value (allocates to activities not outcome drivers)
Activity metrics stable (SLA, bookings, tickets) while enterprise deteriorating (revenue -7%, margins down, satisfaction down)
Enterprise outcome crises forcing intervention: FY2024 -7% revenue, Q4 2024 walk away policy, Q3 2024 sales refresh
disconfirming: No evidence of enterprise optimization incentives—all functions measured locally
No evidence of local/enterprise alignment—divergence pattern consistent
No evidence of proactive enterprise optimization—only reactive crisis interventions

hypothesis_framework.notes: Local optimization pattern clear: Sales optimizes bookings (local) destroys margins (enterprise), support optimizes SLA (local) destroys satisfaction (enterprise), operations optimizes response (local) increases incidents (enterprise). Each function acting rationally under local incentive creates aggregate enterprise dysfunction. Activity metrics (local) stable while financial results (enterprise) deteriorate. CEO forced to intervene reactively (walk away, sales refresh) when enterprise deterioration severe—indicates local optimization not self-correcting. Hypothesis: Enterprise optimization requires incentive realignment—measure functions on enterprise outcomes not local activities.

hypothesis_framework.hypothesis: Execution drag is rational adaptation to incentive structure not cultural dysfunction—changing personnel without changing incentives recreates drag patterns
supporting_evidence_sought: Drag patterns persisting across personnel changes (three CEOs—bottleneck recreates, sales refresh—margin erosion continues)
New personnel exhibiting same drag behaviors as predecessors (rational response to unchanged incentive structure)
Reactive interventions (personnel changes, policies) failing to eliminate drag
Drag patterns rational under current incentive structure (behavior maximizes individual measured performance)
disconfirming_evidence_sought: Drag patterns eliminated through personnel changes without incentive reform
New personnel exhibiting different behaviors than predecessors despite unchanged incentives
Evidence of cultural change (not incentive change) resolving drag
Evidence drag driven by individual values not structural incentives

supporting: Three CEOs in three years (Jones, Maletira, Kandiah)—CEO bottleneck pattern persists across all three, indicates structural not individual issue
Sales refresh Q3 2024—margin erosion continues after personnel change, indicates incentive not individual issue
Walk away policy Q4 2024 reactive—requires ongoing CEO enforcement not self-sustaining behavior change, indicates incentive not cultural issue
Support heroics pattern persistent—informal coordination required regardless of individuals, indicates authority gap not personal deficit
Drag behaviors rational: Sales maximizes bookings (earns commission), support meets SLA (earns performance credit), operations responds to incidents (earns recognition)
disconfirming: No evidence of drag elimination through personnel changes—patterns persist
No evidence of new personnel behaving differently—drag recreates
No evidence of cultural change resolving drag without incentive/authority realignment

hypothesis_framework.notes: Drag patterns persist across personnel changes: Three CEOs inherit same bottleneck, sales refresh doesn't resolve margin erosion, support heroics continue regardless of individuals. Indicates drag driven by incentive structure not individual performance/culture. Individuals acting rationally under incentive structure: Sales maximizes bookings (earns commission), support meets SLA (measured performance), CEO intervenes personally (maintains quarterly results). Personnel changes treat symptom (individuals) not cause (incentives). Hypothesis: Incentive/authority structure reform necessary—personnel optimization insufficient.
